content: The Act is titled the "Citizens and Legal Immigration Act." It includes provisions for judicial review of orders of removal. The "Citizens and Legal Immigration Act" amends Section 242 of the Immigration and Nationality Act to include provisions for judicial review of orders of removal, including habeas corpus provisions from title 28 of the United States Code. The "Citizens and Legal Immigration Act" amends Section 242 of the Immigration and Nationality Act to include provisions for judicial review of orders of removal, including habeas corpus provisions from title 28 of the United States Code. It also allows for judicial review of constitutional claims or pure questions of law raised in a petition for review filed with an appropriate court of appeals. The "Citizens and Legal Immigration Act" amends Section 242 of the Immigration and Nationality Act to include provisions for judicial review of orders of removal, including habeas corpus provisions from title 28 of the United States Code. It establishes that a petition for review filed with an appropriate court of appeals is the exclusive means for judicial review of any cause or claim under the United Nations Convention Against Torture and Other Forms of Cruel, Inhuman, or Degrading Treatment or Punishment. The "Citizens and Legal Immigration Act" amends Section 242 of the Immigration and Nationality Act to establish that judicial review of orders of removal shall be done through a petition filed with a court of appeals, excluding habeas corpus review. The "Citizens and Legal Immigration Act" amends Section 242 of the Immigration and Nationality Act to restrict judicial review of orders of removal through habeas corpus, section 2241 of title 28, or any other provision of law. The amendments take effect upon the enactment of the Act. The "Citizens and Legal Immigration Act" restricts judicial review of removal orders through habeas corpus or other provisions of law. Cases challenging removal orders will be transferred to the court of appeals for review.
